alert.note: Alert for Fond Du Lac (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 11 at 9:28PM CDT until September 13 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of east central Wisconsin, including the following counties, Fond du Lac and Sheboygan. * WHEN...Through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A prolonged period of moderate to heavy rainfall will continue through Monday. Widespread, storm total rainfall amounts between 2 to 4 inches are expected. Persistent bands will be capable of producing rainfall in excess of 4 inches. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
